Stress in hospitals

How stressed are your employees? Do you know what impact it is having on them, on your patients and on your hospital’s budget? We surveyed one hundred thousand hospital staff to ask them how they experience stress at work. Stress affects the vast majority of hospital staff. In fact, only 6% of those surveyed reported experiencing no stress. 39% report high levels of stress.

Hospital staff recognised that stress was also having an impact on patient care. 41% of those who experience high levels of stress at work admitted that it was affecting patient care. And yet according to those same staff, hospital management clearly doesn’t do enough to combat the problem. Indeed, a only 0.07% of respondents reported that management were taking appropriate action. Of the remaining respondents, half reported that measures were infeffective, and the other that management were taking no action at all. Aside from patient care and staff health, stress hurts a hospital’s bottom line through sick leave and high turnover. Stress affects certain departments disproportionally. A staggering 58% of those reporting high levels of stress work within anesthetics. 16% were currently working as General Practioners. Taking department-wide action can make a significant impact on staff as a whole.

Do you want to know if your staff are at risk of stress and its negative impacts? Can you afford to ignore the problem? Head over to our predict page to find out how YOUR staff are feeling.

stressfri

Stressfri is an AI-powered platform to help you capture early signs of stress in your staff and put in the right measures to tackle it.
